items.title: Spurs captain Romero in fiery 'lies' post after loss
items.summary: Tottenham captain Cristian Romero appeared to accuse the club's hierarchy of "lies" in a fiery, now-edited social media post following the defeat to Bournemouth.

items.title: Rosenior unready to coach Chelsea loss at Fulham
items.summary: Liam Rosenior chose not to take charge of Chelsea for the first time in Wednesday's Premier League clash against Fulham because of the "difficult time-frame" between his appointment on Tuesday and the game at Craven Cottage.

items.title: Mourinho on shock loss: I hope players don't sleep
items.summary: An angry Benfica coach Jose Mourinho hopes his players had a sleepless night after their shock defeat to Braga in the Portuguese Allianz Cup semifinal on Wednesday.

items.title: Man United ask Fletcher to coach FA Cup Sunday
items.summary: Darren Fletcher said he will be on the touchline for Manchester United's FA Cup tie against Brighton on Sunday.

items.title: Verwarring in Eindhoven door spandoek: 'PVS wenst je een sportief 2026'
items.summary: Een spandoek in Eindhoven heeft voor de nodige opschudding gezorgd. PSV gaf bij het Philips Stadion een mooie boodschap aan de fans, maar een spelfout werd gezien als hint voor een contractverlenging.

items.title: Alle KKD-wedstrijden dit weekend afgelast, hoop voor Eredivisie
items.summary: De KNVB heeft alle wedstrijden in de Keuken Kampioen Divisie van zaterdag 10 en zondag 11 januari afgelast wegens de weersomstandigheden. Voorlopig gaan de Eredivisie wedstrijden van zaterdag en zondag wel nog door. Eerder ging ook al een streep door alle wedstrijden van vrijdag .

items.title: What next for Arsenal's Nwaneri after season of frustration?
items.summary: Ethan Nwaneri had a breakout season last term - but the young Arsenal forward is in a fight for the game time needed to fulfil his promise.

items.title: Ajax: op naar w√©√©r een wederopbouw vanaf de grond
items.summary: Op een paar uitzonderingen na die juist net in een flow waren geraakt, haalden de Eredivisie-clubs op het tandvlees de winterstop. Veel tijd om weer op adem te komen, hebben ze alleen niet, want dit weekeinde begint het hele circus alweer. In aanloop naar het cruciale deel van het seizoen maken we bij elke club de balans op, waarbij we wat de volgorde betreft uitgaan van de eerste speelronde van 2026. Deze keer: Ajax, dat langzaam uit het diepe dal krabbelt.

items.title: Taylor reist naar Rome om transfer naar Lazio af te ronden
items.summary: Kenneth Taylor gaat Ajax na 15,5 jaar verlaten. Als de laatste formaliteiten worden afgerond, maakt de middenvelder de transfer naar Lazio.

items.title: Exeter City‚Äôs plea for more FA Cup cash from Manchester City turned down
items.summary: League One club asked for greater share of gate receipts Manchester City not changing their standard club policy Manchester City will not offer Exeter extra money from Saturday‚Äôs third-round FA Cup tie. The financially troubled League One club this week revealed they had asked the Premier League club for a greater proportion of the gate receipts as a ‚Äústatement of solidarity‚Äù. Exeter, whose supporters‚Äô trust is the club‚Äôs majority shareholder, will take 8,000 fans to a sold-out Etihad Stadium to face the seven-time FA Cup winners. Each club gets 45% of gate receipts, with the other 10% taken by the Football Association, in line with competition rules. It is estimated ticket sales will generate between ¬£250,000 and ¬£400,000 for Exeter. Continue reading...

items.title: Coote sentenced over child image offence
items.summary: David Coote has been sentenced to nine months in prison, suspended for two years, after pleading guilty to making an indecent image of a child.

items.title: Szoboszlai geeft strijd niet op: 'Je wint de Premier League niet in januari'
items.summary: Dominik Szoboszlai staat met Liverpool veertien punten achter koploper Arsenal, maar begraaft hij de strijdbijl nog niet. Donderdagavond staan beide ploegen tegenover elkaar. 'Wij spelen niet tegen de kampioen, zij spelen tegen de kampioen.'

items.title: Chiefs aware of domestic violence allegations directed towards Rice
items.summary: The Kansas City Chiefs said in a statement on Wednesday they were aware of domestic violence allegations made in a series of social media posts by a former girlfriend of wide receiver Rashee Rice and had been in communication with the NFL.

items.title: Bournemouth keen on Nwaneri - Thursday's gossip
items.summary: Bournemouth are keen on bringing in Ethan Nwaneri from Arsenal, Crystal Palace boss Oliver Glasner set to hold talks over extending deal, AC Milan keen on Liverpool defender Joe Gomez, plus more.

items.title: Captain Romero appears to call out Spurs chiefs in edited social media post
items.summary: Tottenham captain Cristian Romero appears to take aim at the club's hierarchy, accusing them of telling "lies" in a since edited Instagram post.

items.title: ‚ÄòThe club is in a mess‚Äô: Manchester United fans voice feelings before the next interim twist
items.summary: Supporters serenaded Solskj√¶r, Carrick and Fletcher among others at Burnley and staged a brief anti-Ratcliffe protest ‚ÄúJim can‚Äôt fix this,‚Äù the sign said. Bright red letters nestled on a white background, a stark contrast in an away end at Turf Moor full of dark-coated figures in front of which they were held aloft. It was small, a couple of square metres of material, maybe. But the message to Sir Jim Ratcliffe was powerful. Remember your lane, Jim? Yeah, stick in it, pal. As Darren Fletcher, in Manchester United blazer and red tie, strolled along the touchline, flanked by tracksuited his former teammate and friend Jonny Evans, the flag flew. And then it was gone. The protest was done. Continue reading...

items.title: Can Coventry recover from recent blip to maintain promotion charge?
items.summary: Six points clear at the top of the Championship as we swing into January was more than any Coventry City fan would have expected when the seaason started back in August.

items.title: Fresh start or back to square one? Either way, Man United are never dull
items.summary: After the tumult of Ruben Amorim's dismissal on Monday, Darren Fletcher and Manchester United's 2-2 draw vs. Burnley was fittingly dramatic.

items.title: Terry Yorath, former Wales and Leeds midfielder, dies aged 75
items.summary: A league champion with Leeds, midfielder won 59 caps As Wales manager just missed out on 1994 World Cup The former Leeds and Wales midfielder Terry Yorath has died at the age of 75 after a short illness, his family have said in a statement. Born in Cardiff, Yorath played a big part in the Leeds team under Don Revie, winning the First Division title in 1974, before spells with Coventry, Tottenham and Bradford. He also won 59 caps for Wales. Continue reading...

items.title: Football transfer rumours: Ethan Nwaneri to replace Semenyo at Bournemouth?
items.summary: Today‚Äôs rumours are riding the District line Antoine Semenyo‚Äôs farewell goal for Bournemouth, before his move to Manchester City, sets off a chain reaction over who succeeds him. Ethan Nwaneri, who has struggled for game time at Arsenal, is wanted by a few suitors. Bournemouth are very interested in a loan move for someone who was the next big thing not too long ago. And still can be, though the word is he still wishes to stay a Gunner and play his part in a title-winning team. Continue reading...
